page.title: 09TREVOLLARD HOUSE - TREMATON
page.content: Trevollard House was built as a farm house in 1709. A few years later it became redundant and was converted into a private school for young ladies. In 1900 this school closed, the building was de-roofed for the valuable slates and it subsequently collapsed. In the 1920s about a third of the original house was salvaged for use by farm workers, farmers and mothers. In 1975 planning permission was granted for the remaining two thirds of the house to be rebuilt. The finished house was then sold to the present owner, who carried out further renovation before moving from Saltash to live in it in 1977. Born in a cottage in Trematon, this lady enjoys gardening and rescuing cobble stones, and she helps the Womens Institute and Merchant Navy Wives club.
